intro: Esenbeckia warscewiczii, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
